oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Bushman Doctor or Sorcerer (L II.
275). An account of these people was also given in the Katkop dialect by Dia!kwáin (L V.
4131), from whom we besides have two reports of cures performed upon himself. The first of these (L V.
4199) includes a speech made by the sorceress; the second relates how she cured him when injured by a Kafir (L V.
4230). A note about the old sorceress !kwarra
an, where she lived and lives, her Dutch name (Mietje); how her husband ≠gerri
sse (or Jan Ronebout) and a son were shot by a Dutch man ('Boer') when out getting poison for their arrows.
